TopicTitle: Remove mandatory WYSIWYG for forum posts

Articles.Content:
Please, for the love of all that is holy, remove the needless mandatory WYSIWYG editor for forum posts.  Or give us a button to switch it to plain text or something.  Quoting someone, especially multi-quoting or removing centered text, things like that, is needlessly complicated by this ridiculous editor.

Please, a plain text option.  That's it.  Mobile users will love you.

Thank you.

I'd like to second this, as I've found that without the source available, I can't even add an extra link to download one of my mods; on my Kerbal Joint Reinforcement page I'd like to add a link to it on SpaceDock, but for some reason I can't; it will be set up in editing and then disappear when I try to confirm it.  What is the reasoning behind keeping the source hidden?

I'm thirding this, even though this is far from the first thread about this and I have made my opinion known previously. TBH I think SQUAD is dead-set on keeping the editor exactly the way it is, but here's hoping otherwise.

fourted?

Even USENET clients injected quotes for me.  This forum does strange things on my phone with quotes, like requiring me to have an extra line under them and all the text cleared out in order to remove them and crap like that.  Even BBCode editing on the old forums with my phone with like, two lines of text showing was easier.

It's clearly not user-friendly.  At all.

Amen. Just the other day I discovered that it's impossible extremely difficult to post links to a YouTube video WITHOUT making a huge video preview - which sometimes, we actually don't want. What if I want to link five different videos in the same post, for example, or my post has a brief reference to a YouTube video but is mainly focused on something else?
The only way I found to do it was to manually make a link using the "Link" button and ensure that the link text was not the video URL. Very inconvenient.
It also breaks the default imgur embed code a lot, doesn't allow changes to the image URL once an image has been embedded (say I decide to use the medium thumbnail instead of the large one, etc.), doesn't allow much of anything BBcode-based (i.e. embed links from various other sites), and sometimes just plain breaks altogether, mangling or losing the entire post.

There have already been many complaints about the editor. Thing is, we are not aware of any way to switch to BBCode available (if there was a reliable option we'd certainly make it available), and we're not going to allow HTML editing at all.

While I too liked the BBCode of vBulletin, we can't go back to 4 or forward to 5. It's just not happening, 4 is being unsupported soon, and 5 would result in a full rewipe of the forums.

For the love for all that is good, I don't understand why SQUAD decided to replace a perfectly working forum by a WYSIWYG version that no one wanted. Why don't they listen to the content creaters, the modders for a change and help them instead of making they life harder?
